title: Since updating I can't transfer funds on WELLS FARGO website
content:
For years, I've used the Firefox browser to do my online banking at Wells Fargo. I frequently transfer funds. For the first time, this month when I tried to transfer payment to my new Wells Fargo credit card, none of the menu items on the Transfer Page would open. I had to call the bank to do the transaction. Today I attempted to do another transfer of funds, using firefox and when I landed on the page, again the page was dead~ as in none of the items would open or appear that allow the transfer of funds. I called the bank to report the problem, and was asked to attempt to log in to my account from Chrome. I did this, and there was NO PROBLEM. ALL pages opened as they normally should, and I made my transfer of funds.

I use Firefox because I HATE GOOGLE. So to be directed there because firefox now has a BUG that prevents the smooth BANKING transactions I need, means that YOUR BROWSER IS NO GOOD TO ME. I see that you've had problems like this reported for a while. PLEASE FIX THIS. I don't want to HAVE to use google/CHROME for anything.
creator: WtrLily

title: I am trying to access the GIS site on our county's home page; all functions work but the GIS
content:
I am trying to access the GIS function at https://www.mitchellcounty.org/departments/mapping-land-records/

I can access every other function on the site but the GIS. I have successfully used my current setup in the past with no problems. I have a desktop computer with Windows 10 and Firefox [both updated]. I have a subscription to PC Matic monitoring my set up and all software is certified as up to date; same with BelArc monitoring after each Windows update. My ISP is a local high speed cable company and I have had no problems with them

I contacted someone in my county with the same set up as I and he is having no problem with accessing the GIS.

Although I am not a techie I am an experienced online searcher [genealogy] and access all varieties of sites and haven't a problem with access on any. Any help is greatly appreciated; I need to access the GIS to provide some info to our POA.

The county person in charge of the GIS said I should change my browser; I have used Firefox exclusively forever; I hate to download software only to discover that the problem still is there.

title: Browsing being interrupted by recommendation to install a third-part ad blocker. Security risk?
content:
I've just had my browsing interrupted with this recommendation to install an extension: https://torrent-protection.com/download-now/

I was viewing this page: https://www.eurogamer.net/with-the-new-ps-plus-premium-and-extra-sony-opts-for-the-car-boot-sale-approach-to-catalogue-gaming

I was taken out of the page without pressing anything and taken to this recommendation. In particular, it appears like an official Firefox message and security recommendation, with Firefox suggesting I should install this extension for my security. Sadly I don't have a screenshot but it's happened twice this morning already.

Is this really Firefox endorsed? Or are they pushing their extension with fake credentials? How is the page viewing interrupted this way and diverted automatically to another webpage?

title: Upgrade 24/6/2022
content:
Mozilla Firefox was automatically upgraded as I opened my computer. The new version started and the startup page was shown as if I had never used the Firefox browser on this computer before. I've been running Firefox on this computer for at least 6 years. All my saved data was gone. No bookmarks, no saved access accounts. When it asked me to migrate my data I didn't have the option to migrate any of my saved data from my previous version of Firefox. How do I get all my saved data back? I also received a message that one of my my gmail email account had been accessed by an unauthorized party. Is this also part of the installation process?

Please let me know what to do to get my saved data back.

Walter Fiori
creator: wfiori

title: 2FA generated code useless, kept getting pissed-off by email sent code
content:
Hello Everyone.

I've been using Firefox for the longest time I can remember. I loved it. And I also have found the Firefox Account function quite convenient and useful. Also an avid fan. However, as of two months ago, I needed to re-install my Ubuntu OS on my laptop and of course Firefox as well. I enabled 2FA as I did before and it was a breeze. However, when I started using it (Account log-in/log-out) I keep getting asked to have the confirmation via my email and NOT via the 2FA app generated code I registered with it. At first, I still have the patience for it. But after several months, I am already pissed off. It's such an unbearable nuisance already, when I always have my 2FA app that I can always refer to in a snap. I really hate what's happening now. Can anybody please tell me what went wrong with Firefox 2FA account and why it keeps bugging me for email confirmation and not use the 2FA generated code? Makes me think all my efforts in setting the 2FA app useless and I've had enough already.

Thank you everyone for your help.
creator: myzeroconf

title: Prijava v račun
content:
Pozdravljeni,

zaradi obnove računalnika sem ponovno naložila brskalnik Firefox in se nisem mogla prijavit v svoj račun z svojim pravim emailom in geslom. Ugotovila sem da je ralog, ker se je pojavil Pocket ki ga prej ni bilo in nisem nikoli imela težave z prijavo. Sedaj sem se prijavila preko google, toda moj račun je popolnoma prazen, kot da nikoli niti ni obstajal, ničesar ni kot je bilo. Prosim za pomoč, da povrnem svoj račun v stanju, kakor je bil prej v nasprotnem bom reklamirala vaš brskalnik. Hvala.

LP, Silvija.

title: Cada vez que cierro el explorador, mis bloqueos personalizados de AdBlock se borran
content:
Desde que Facebook implementó las historias, reels y demás, siempre he usado AdBlock (con distintos navegadores) para "borrar" esa sección; acabo de migrar a FF y tengo el problema enunciado en el título; cada vez que cierro (y vuelvo a abrir) FF, al entrar a Facebook, esa sección sigue apareciendo y la tengo que volver a bloquear.

Antes de publicar, busqué temas similares y leí uno en el que las estaciones de radio (o algo así) que guardaba un usuario igualmente se borraban cada que reiniciaba el navegador. No sé si tenga que ver, pero creo que podría deberse a la configuración de cookies que emplea FF (?).

Agradeceré cualquier comentario.
creator: suicidebomber

title: [LINUX][NON-WINDOWS][ONLY REPRODUCABLE ON LINUX] Sessionstore variables for OS restart don't do anything
content:
browser.sessionstore.resuming_after_OS_restart = false. My browser still restores on os restart. Startup -> Restore previous windows and tabs is unchecked browser.sessionstore.max_resumed_crashes = 0 browser.sessionstore.restore_on_demand = false browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash = false

I do not and will not manually close my browser session every time I want to shut down my computer in order to get it to do what it's supposed to. Linux sends SIGTERM to all running processes on shutdown. Firefox isn't handling this correctly, obviously, because if it was, then my settings would be getting respected. SIGTERM is the standard signal sent to windows that need to close gracefully and are expected to still be functional.

NOTE: Do not provide windows-specific support to this thread. I am not running firefox on windows, and I do not possess a windows computer or license.
creator: ctrentsj
